title: Studying Lobby Influence in the European Parliament. (arXiv:2309.11381v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: We present a method based on natural language processing (NLP), for studying the influence of interest groups (lobbies) in the law-making process in the European Parliament (EP). We collect and analyze novel datasets of lobbies' position papers and speeches made by members of the EP (MEPs). By comparing these texts on the basis of semantic similarity and entailment, we are able to discover interpretable links between MEPs and lobbies. In the absence of a ground-truth dataset of such links, we perform an indirect validation by comparing the discovered links with a dataset, which we curate, of retweet links between MEPs and lobbies, and with the publicly disclosed meetings of MEPs. Our best method achieves an AUC score of 0.77 and performs significantly better than several baselines. translated_title: 研究欧洲议会中游说影响的方法
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种基于自然语言处理（NLP）的方法，用于研究欧洲议会中利益集团（游说团体）在立法过程中的影响力。我们收集和分析了游说团体的立场文件和议员的讲话，通过比较这些文本的语义相似性和蕴含关系，我们能够发现议员和游说团体之间的可解释联系。在缺乏这种联系的真实数据集的情况下，我们通过将发现的联系与我们策划的一份关于议员和游说团体之间转发链接的数据集以及议员公开披露的会议进行间接验证。我们的最佳方法达到了0.77的AUC分数，并且比几个基准方法表现得更好。此外，对于发现的链接进行的综合分析，涉及相关游说团体和议员的政治团体，与这些团体的意识形态的预期相一致（例如，中左翼团体）。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种基于自然语言处理的方法，用于研究欧洲议会中利益集团（游说团体）的影响力。通过比较利益集团的立场文件和议员的讲话，发现了议员和游说团体之间的联系，并验证了这些联系的有效性。研究结果表明，这种方法能够准确地揭示议员与游说团体之间的关系，对于理解议会立法过程中游说的影响具有重要意义。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a method based on natural language processing to study the influence of interest groups (lobbies) in the European Parliament. By comparing the position papers of lobbies and speeches made by MEPs, interpretable links between MEPs and lobbies are discovered and validated. The research findings demonstrate that this method accurately reveals the relationships between MEPs and lobbies, which is crucial for understanding the impact of lobbying in the legislative process.
